Description: State or territory name

From the CDC and the Department of Justice's 2018 survey of medical examiner and coroner's offices. * = The state has a state medical examiner office in addition to city, county, district or regional medical examiner or coroner offices

Count of COVID-19 deaths from January 1, 2020, to December 4, 2021. ** = This data includes 2021 year-to-date data and is incomplete. As provisional data is added, audited and made final, these datasets will be updated. Last updated December 12, 2021.

Crude rate per 100,000 people of COVID-19 deaths, from January 1, 2020, to December 4, 2021. ** = This data includes 2021 year-to-date data and is incomplete. As provisional data is added, audited and made final, these datasets will be updated. Last updated December 12, 2021.

Count of all deaths from January 1, 2020, to December 4, 2021. ** = This data includes 2021 year-to-date data and is incomplete. As provisional data is added, audited and made final, these datasets will be updated. Last updated December 12, 2021.

Crude rate per 100,000 people of all deaths, from January 1, 2020, to date. ** = This data includes 2021 year-to-date data and is incomplete. As provisional data is added, audited and made final, these datasets will be updated. Last updated Dec. 6, 2021.

Count of all deaths occurring at home from January 1, 2020, to December 4, 2021. ** = This data includes 2021 year-to-date data and is incomplete. As provisional data is added, audited and made final, these datasets will be updated. Last updated December 12, 2021.

Ratio of deaths occurring at home versus all deaths, from January 1, 2020, to December 4, 2021. ** = This data includes 2021 year-to-date data and is incomplete. As provisional data is added, audited and made final, these datasets will be updated. Last updated December 12, 2021.

Count of COVID-19 deaths from January 1, 2021, to December 4, 2021. ** = This data includes 2021 year-to-date data and is incomplete. As provisional data is added, audited and made final, these datasets will be updated. Last updated December 12, 2021.

Estimate of the July 1, 2020, population of the country, last updated in May 2021. 2020 Census population data source: https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/popest/technical-documentation/research/evaluation-estimates/2020-evaluation-estimates/2010s-state-total.html
Count of COVID-19 deaths from January 1, 2020, to December 31, 2020, which is still provisional and not yet final.
Crude rate per 100,000 people of COVID-19 deaths from January 1, 2020, to December 31, 2020, which is still provisional and not yet final.
Count of all deaths from January 1, 2020, to December 31, 2020, which is still provisional and not yet final.
Modeling calculation of the number of "excess deaths," in 2020 aggregated up from county to state level, compared to what would be expected in a hypothetical year without the COVID-19 pandemic.
Estimate of the July 1, 2019, population of the country.

Count of deaths occurring in nursing homes and long term care facilities by state, from January 1, 2019, to December 31, 2019. Death rates for this catergory were marked "Not Applicable" in the state-level and county-level data pulled from CDC Wonder. Population and rates are labeled "Not Applicable" when Autopsy, Place of Death, Weekday or Month are grouped by or limited, due to lack of a valid population.

Count of deaths among White Non-Hispanic people by state from January 1, 2021, to November 20, 2021. This figure also includes deaths that CDC WONDER logs as White with ethnicity listed "Not Stated." Data are provisional and not yet final.
Estimate of the White Non-Hispanic population by state in 2021.
Crude rate per 100,000 people of deaths in 2021 among White Non-Hispanic people. This rate is not age-adjusted and is provisional and not yet final.

Count of deaths among White Non-Hispanic people by state from January 1, 2020, to December 31, 2020. This figure also includes deaths that CDC WONDER logs as White with ethnicity listed "Not Stated." Data are provisional and not yet final.
Estimate of the White Non-Hispanic population by state in 2020.
Crude rate per 100,000 people of deaths in 2020 among White Non-Hispanic people. This rate is not age-adjusted and is provisional and not yet final.
Count of deaths among White Non-Hispanic people by state from January 1, 2019, to December 31, 2019. This figure also includes deaths that CDC WONDER logs as White with ethnicity listed "Not Stated."
Estimate of the White Non-Hispanic population by state in 2019.
Crude rate per 100,000 people of deaths in 2019 among White Non-Hispanic people. This rate is not age-adjusted.

Crude rate per 100,000 people of deaths in 2019 among Black Non-Hispanic people. This rate is not age-adjusted.

Count of deaths among Hispanic or Latino people by state from January 1, 2021 to November 20, 2021. This figure includes deaths listed with races White, Black, Asian, Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander (where applicable), and Native American or Alaska Native (where applicable). Data are provisional and not yet final.

Estimate of the Hispanic or Latino population by state in 2021. This figure includes populations listed with races White, Black, Asian, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (where applicable), and Native American or Alaska Native (where applicable).
Crude rate per 100,000 people of deaths in 2021 among Hispanic or Latino people. This rate is not age-adjusted and is provisional and not yet final.

Count of deaths occurring in nursing homes and long term care facilities by state, from January 1, 2021 through October 23, 2021 as of November 7, 2021, based on partial, provisional mortality statistics from the CDC. Death rates for this catergory were marked "Not Applicable" in the state-level and county-level data pulled from CDC Wonder. Population and rates are labeled "Not Applicable" when Autopsy, Place of Death, Weekday or Month are grouped by or limited, due to lack of a valid population.

Count of deaths occurring in nursing homes and long term care facilities by state, from January 1, 2020 to December 31, 2020, based on CDC provisional mortality statistics. Death rates for this catergory were marked "Not Applicable" in the state-level and county-level data pulled from CDC Wonder. Population and rates are labeled "Not Applicable" when Autopsy, Place of Death, Weekday or Month are grouped by or limited, due to lack of a valid population.

Count of deaths occurring in nursing homes and long term care facilities by state, from January 1, 2019 to December 31, 2019. Death rates for this catergory were marked "Not Applicable" in the state-level and county-level data pulled from CDC Wonder. Population and rates are labeled "Not Applicable" when Autopsy, Place of Death, Weekday or Month are grouped by or limited, due to lack of a valid population.

Count of natural cause deaths by state from January 1, 2021, to November 20, 2021, based on partial, provisional mortality statistics from the CDC. This field includes all medical underlying causes of death (or ICD-10 codes), including A00-B99, C00-D89, E00-E88, F01-F99, G00-G98, H00-H57, H60-H93, I00-I99, J00-J98, K00-K92, L00-L98, M00-M99, N00-N98, P00-P96, Q00-Q99, R00-R99, U00-U99.

Crude rate per 100,000 people of natural cause deaths by state from January 1, 2021 to November 20, 2021 based on partial, provisional mortality statistics from the CDC. The rates were calculated using default intercensal populations for years 2001 to 2009, excluding Infant Age Groups.

Count of natural cause deaths by state from January 1, 2020 to December 31, 2020, based on partial, provisional mortality statistics from the CDC. This field includes all medical underlying causes of death (or ICD-10 codes), including A00-B99, C00-D89, E00-E88, F01-F99, G00-G98, H00-H57, H60-H93, I00-I99, J00-J98, K00-K92, L00-L98, M00-M99, N00-N98, P00-P96, Q00-Q99, R00-R99, U00-U99.

Crude rate per 100,000 people of natural cause deaths by state from January 1, 2020 to December 31, 2020 based on partial, provisional mortality statistics from the CDC. The rates were calculated using default intercensal populations for years 2001 to 2009, excluding Infant Age Groups.

Count of natural cause deaths by state from January 1, 2019 to December 31, 2019. This field includes all medical underlying causes of death (or ICD-10 codes), including A00-B99, C00-D89, E00-E88, F01-F99, G00-G98, H00-H57, H60-H93, I00-I99, J00-J98, K00-K92, L00-L98, M00-M99, N00-N98, P00-P96, Q00-Q99, R00-R99, U00-U99.

Crude rate per 100,000 people of natural cause deaths by state from January 1, 2019 to December 31, 2019. The rates were calculated using default intercensal populations for years 2001 to 2009, excluding Infant Age Groups.

Count of external cause deaths by state from January 1, 2021, to November 20, 2021, based on partial, provisional mortality statistics from the CDC. Underlying cause of death, or ICD-10, is coded as V01-Y89, which the CDC collectively terms "External causes of morbidity and mortality."

Crude rate per 100,000 people of external cause deaths from January 1, 2021, to November 20, 2021, based on partial, provisional mortality statistics from the CDC. The rates were calculated using default intercensal populations for years 2001 to 2009, excluding Infant Age Groups.

Crude rate per 100,000 people of external cause deaths from January 1, 2019 to December 31, 2019. The rates were calculated using default intercensal populations for years 2001 to 2009, excluding Infant Age Groups.
